title: Repeated parsing of ca-certificates
body:

### I did this

Visited [a web site](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news) in [NetSurf](https://www.netsurf-browser.org/), which [uses libcurl](http://git.netsurf-browser.org/netsurf.git/tree/content/fetchers/curl.c) and openssl.

```bash
./nsfb -f sdl https://www.bbc.co.uk/news
```

### I expected the following

Did not expect the X509 certificate parsing to dominate the time spent loading the page.

See the following profile:

![Screenshot from 2022-08-28 12-27-46](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8228915/187071797-d709ffe5-da01-4426-8d6a-aea429f77ee2.png)

```bash
valgrind --tool=callgrind ./nsfb -f sdl https://www.bbc.co.uk/news
```

This shows that the `X509_LOOKUP_ctrl_ex` function takes 87% of the total time spent processing the page. That calls through to `X509_load_cert_crl_file_ex`, etc.

Running it again under strace:

```bash
strace -o log -eopenat  ./nsfb -f sdl https://www.bbc.co.uk/news
```

We can see that the certificates file is opened 15 times:

```bash
grep -c "ca-certificates" log
15
grep "ca-certificates" log
openat(AT_FDCWD, "/etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt", O_RDONLY) = 8
openat(AT_FDCWD, "/etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt", O_RDONLY) = 11
openat(AT_FDCWD, "/etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt", O_RDONLY) = 11
openat(AT_FDCWD, "/etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt", O_RDONLY) = 11
openat(AT_FDCWD, "/etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt", O_RDONLY) = 12
openat(AT_FDCWD, "/etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt", O_RDONLY) = 13
openat(AT_FDCWD, "/etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt", O_RDONLY) = 14
openat(AT_FDCWD, "/etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt", O_RDONLY) = 12
openat(AT_FDCWD, "/etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt", O_RDONLY) = 17
openat(AT_FDCWD, "/etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt", O_RDONLY) = 17
openat(AT_FDCWD, "/etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt", O_RDONLY) = 17
openat(AT_FDCWD, "/etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt", O_RDONLY) = 18
openat(AT_FDCWD, "/etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt", O_RDONLY) = 20
openat(AT_FDCWD, "/etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt", O_RDONLY) = 20
openat(AT_FDCWD, "/etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt", O_RDONLY) = 20
```

So it looks like `/etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt` is opened and parsed over and over again. Can anything be done to change to parsing it once and keeping it cached?

### curl/libcurl version

curl 7.81.0 (x86_64-pc-linux-gnu) libcurl/7.81.0 OpenSSL/3.0.2 zlib/1.2.11 brotli/1.0.9 zstd/1.4.8 libidn2/2.3.2 libpsl/0.21.0 (+libidn2/2.3.2) libssh/0.9.6/openssl/zlib nghttp2/1.43.0 librtmp/2.3 OpenLDAP/2.5.12
